column4: how do i check ubuntu's available disk size if i installed with wubi?
df -h from a terminal should work
is it possible to increase the size allocated after i installed with wubi?
i wouldn't touch wubi (or a wubi question) with a 30 foot pole.  Good luck.
are you sure your 3D is still working?
what graphics card?  "lspci | grep -i vga" if you aren't sure.
open nvidia-settings what driver does it report using?  (i'm just interested if it's nvidia or not)
how? i cant find the additional driver program any more
you'd have to ask someone using 11.10 then.  sorry i don't know.
there is no such thing as nvidia-settings for me
then my guess is you don't have the proprietary nvidia driver installed (unless it's become a separate package)
